title: How to Clean Resin

steps.headline: Clean your pipe regularly.
steps.description: If you regularly smoke marijuana or tobacco, your pipe or bong should be cleaned regularly. The longer you leave resin sitting on a pipe or bong, the worse it will become. Clean your pipe or bong after each use.

steps.headline: Use a plant-based cleaner.
steps.description: Chemical cleaners can damage a pipe or bong and are bad to inhale. Opt to use plant-based cleaners. Check the label to make sure a cleaner uses only plant based products. After using your pipe, add 10 drops of the cleaner to the bowl. If you live near a head shop, a worker there can help you find a solid plant-based cleaner for your pipe or bong.

steps.headline: Let the cleaner sit overnight.
steps.description: You do not need to wipe cleaner off right away. Let it sit on overnight. This will break down resin and prevent it from sticking to your pipe. If you smoke each day, it's easy to remember. You will simply add the 10 drops after you finish smoking and rinse out the bong or pipe before you use it again.

steps.headline: Rinse out the cleaner.
steps.description: Use clean, hot water to rinse out the cleaner. The resin should come out easily when running your pipe or bong under the faucet. Once the cleaner and resin are fully rinsed out, you can use your pipe or bong again.

steps.headline: Do not use chemical or alcohol-based cleaners.
steps.description: Never use isopropyl alcohol to clean a bong or pipe, as this can be hazardous if inhaled. Do not use nail polish, especially acetone-based nail polish, to clean resin from a pipe or bong.

steps.headline: Remove the platform and tank.
steps.description: In order to clean resin from a 3D printer, you will first have to remove the resin tank and platform. To do so, remove the platform first to avoid getting resin on it. Then, gently slide the resin tray out of place by holding it by the front tabs, sides, or rims. Avoid touching the glass as you do not want to stain it with fingerprints. Some resin trays may be held in place with tabs, so consult your user's manual for precise instructions for your machine.

steps.headline: Pour the resin in a storage container.
steps.description: If you have an old resin bottle on hand, it's best to use this to store the resin. Do not pour old resin into a bottle of new resin. Pour the resin into an old container so the tray is completely empty.

steps.headline: Spray and wipe down the tank.
steps.description: Use a spray bottle filled with isopropyl alcohol to clean the tray. You can buy isopropyl alcohol online or at a department store. Gently spritz down the inside of the tank with the alcohol. Then, use a wipe out any stuck-on resin using a paper towel.

steps.headline: Clean the glass window.
steps.description: The glass window found above the tray should be cleaned as well. Some resin may be stuck onto the glass. Put on a pair of nitrile or neoprene gloves (not latex) and use your fingers to gently rub or peel off any resin. If any alcohol got onto the glass tray, use a lens wipe or microfiber cloth to remove it.

steps.headline: Remove the cushions.
steps.description: You should remove any cushions from your resin furniture before cleaning it. As you'll be soaking the furniture, cushions need to be removed to prevent water damage. Take any cushions off the furniture and set them aside.

steps.headline: Soak the furniture in water.
steps.description: Resin furniture is waterproof, so it's safe to soak it in water prior to cleaning. The easiest way to to do this is to spray down your furniture with a hose. Spray your furniture until all parts are completely wet. If you don't have a hose, use water buckets to dump water over your furniture.

steps.headline: Make your cleaner.
steps.description: Mild laundry detergent and dish soap are safe to use on resin furniture. Fill a gallon size bucket with warm water. Then, mix in a quarter cup of either mild laundry detergent or dish soap. You can also spray the furniture with an appropriate commercial cleaner, such as a mildew remover if there’s mold or mildew, or an adhesive remover if there’s sap. Be sure to rinse away the cleaner immediately after to avoid damaging your furniture.

steps.headline: Scrub down your furniture.
steps.description: Use a soft bristle brush to clean resin furniture. Gently scrub the furniture down with the brush until you dislodge or remove any unwanted dirt or debris. Make sure to get the cracks between the weaves on your furniture. There are many nooks and crannies that need cleaning when it comes to resin furniture.

steps.headline: Rinse your furniture.
steps.description: You rinse your furniture the same way you initially soaked it. Use a hose or bucket to spray down the furniture. Keep spraying the furniture, or dumping buckets of water on it, until the water runs clean. Soap residue can damage your furniture. Don’t let the water pool on the furniture or sit for too long as this may damage your furniture.

steps.headline: Let your furniture air dry.
steps.description: Place your furniture in the sun. In about two hours, it should be completely dry. At this point, you can put any cushions back on your furniture and resume using it as usual.

text: Cleaning a Pipe or Bong Clean your pipe regularly. If you regularly smoke marijuana or tobacco, your pipe or bong should be cleaned regularly. The longer you leave resin sitting on a pipe or bong, the worse it will become. Clean your pipe or bong after each use. Use a plant-based cleaner. Chemical cleaners can damage a pipe or bong and are bad to inhale. Opt to use plant-based cleaners. Check the label to make sure a cleaner uses only plant based products. After using your pipe, add 10 drops of the cleaner to the bowl. If you live near a head shop, a worker there can help you find a solid plant-based cleaner for your pipe or bong. Let the cleaner sit overnight. You do not need to wipe cleaner off right away. Let it sit on overnight. This will break down resin and prevent it from sticking to your pipe. If you smoke each day, it's easy to remember. You will simply add the 10 drops after you finish smoking and rinse out the bong or pipe before you use it again. Rinse out the cleaner. Use clean, hot water to rinse out the cleaner. The resin should come out easily when running your pipe or bong under the faucet. Once the cleaner and resin are fully rinsed out, you can use your pipe or bong again. Do not use chemical or alcohol-based cleaners. Never use isopropyl alcohol to clean a bong or pipe, as this can be hazardous if inhaled. Do not use nail polish, especially acetone-based nail polish, to clean resin from a pipe or bong. Cleaning a 3D Printer's Resin Tray Remove the platform and tank. In order to clean resin from a 3D printer, you will first have to remove the resin tank and platform. To do so, remove the platform first to avoid getting resin on it. Then, gently slide the resin tray out of place by holding it by the front tabs, sides, or rims. Avoid touching the glass as you do not want to stain it with fingerprints. Some resin trays may be held in place with tabs, so consult your user's manual for precise instructions for your machine. Pour the resin in a storage container. If you have an old resin bottle on hand, it's best to use this to store the resin. Do not pour old resin into a bottle of new resin. Pour the resin into an old container so the tray is completely empty. Spray and wipe down the tank. Use a spray bottle filled with isopropyl alcohol to clean the tray. You can buy isopropyl alcohol online or at a department store. Gently spritz down the inside of the tank with the alcohol. Then, use a wipe out any stuck-on resin using a paper towel. Clean the glass window. The glass window found above the tray should be cleaned as well. Some resin may be stuck onto the glass. Put on a pair of nitrile or neoprene gloves (not latex) and use your fingers to gently rub or peel off any resin. If any alcohol got onto the glass tray, use a lens wipe or microfiber cloth to remove it. Cleaning Resin Wicker Furniture Remove the cushions. You should remove any cushions from your resin furniture before cleaning it. As you'll be soaking the furniture, cushions need to be removed to prevent water damage. Take any cushions off the furniture and set them aside. Soak the furniture in water. Resin furniture is waterproof, so it's safe to soak it in water prior to cleaning. The easiest way to to do this is to spray down your furniture with a hose. Spray your furniture until all parts are completely wet. If you don't have a hose, use water buckets to dump water over your furniture. Make your cleaner. Mild laundry detergent and dish soap are safe to use on resin furniture. Fill a gallon size bucket with warm water. Then, mix in a quarter cup of either mild laundry detergent or dish soap. You can also spray the furniture with an appropriate commercial cleaner, such as a mildew remover if there’s mold or mildew, or an adhesive remover if there’s sap. Be sure to rinse away the cleaner immediately after to avoid damaging your furniture. Scrub down your furniture. Use a soft bristle brush to clean resin furniture. Gently scrub the furniture down with the brush until you dislodge or remove any unwanted dirt or debris. Make sure to get the cracks between the weaves on your furniture. There are many nooks and crannies that need cleaning when it comes to resin furniture. Rinse your furniture. You rinse your furniture the same way you initially soaked it. Use a hose or bucket to spray down the furniture. Keep spraying the furniture, or dumping buckets of water on it, until the water runs clean. Soap residue can damage your furniture. Don’t let the water pool on the furniture or sit for too long as this may damage your furniture. Let your furniture air dry. Place your furniture in the sun. In about two hours, it should be completely dry. At this point, you can put any cushions back on your furniture and resume using it as usual.
